API Evangelist Location API

This is a location API, providing many of the common building blocks of location. Providing the essential location ingredients needed through a varietiy of applications, without having to reivent the wheel each times it is needed. This API is still being working on, and not quite ready for prime time, but if you have any questions, visit the road map and support sections below the documentation

Signing Up / Logging In For The API

I don't make you sign up for yet another account, we just use your OAuth from your GitHub, Twitter, or LinkedIn.

Github

Login with your Github social coding platform account.

Twitter

Login / Sign Up with your Twitter social networking account.

LinkedIn

Login / Sign Up with your LinkedIn business social networking account.

I'm not interested in your data, and do not pull any other data from your accounts beyond the scaope requested.

Authentication For The APIs

This is the authentication for this API, providing you with the information you need to securely make API calls.

  • → x-api-key - Your API key.

We try to keep API authentication as simple as possible, while also ensuring the data we provide is securely accessed.

API Documentation

This is the interactive API documentation for this API, and when you are authenticated, will allow you to make API calls, and see the responses for each API path.

Get Cities - Get all cities.

URL: https://example.com/cities/

Authentication:
x-api-key:
Query Parameters:
query: The query string
Add City - Add a city.

URL: https://example.com/cities/

Authentication:
x-api-key:
Get City - Get a single city.

URL: https://example.com/cities/{city_id}/

Authentication:
x-api-key:
Path Parameters:
city_id: The unique id.
Update City - Update a city.

URL: https://example.com/cities/{city_id}/

Authentication:
x-api-key:
Path Parameters:
city_id: The unique id.
Delete City - Delete a city.

URL: https://example.com/cities/{city_id}/

Authentication:
x-api-key:
Path Parameters:
city_id: The unique id.

This documentation is generated from the OpenAPI definition for this API, which you can use to publish, syndicate, and integrate with this API documentation elsewhere.

API Schema

This is the schema definition for this API, describing the schema for requests and responses.

cities

  • city (array) - All of the cities being returned.

city

  • id (integer) - The unique id for the city.
  • region_id (integer) - The unique id for the region.
  • country_id (integer) - The unique id for the country.
  • latitude (number) - The latitude of the city.
  • longitude (number) - The longitude of the city.
  • name (string) - The name of the city.

countries

  • city (array) - All of the countries returned.

country

  • id (integer) - The uniqud id for the country.
  • name (string) - The name of the country.
  • code (string) - The country code for this country.

regions

  • city (array) - All of the regions being returned.

region

  • id (integer) - The unique id for the region.
  • name (string) - The name of the region.
  • code (string) - The code for the region.
  • country_id (integer) - The unique country id for the region.

errorResponse

  • code (integer) - Repeat the HTTP status code
  • message (integer) - A plain language message explaining the error

Request


This documentation is driven by JSON schema, which is available as part of the OpenAPI.
